main event: On 8th July 1952 at 22:40, Clayton Warren witnessed a silent, bright object moving across the sky. It appeared to be 100-150 feet in length and oblong or oval in shape, moving steadily before disappearing from view.
interesting points: The object was described as silent and much larger than a star, moving steadily and level in flight.
It descended slightly before disappearing from view in the west.
The witness, Clayton Warren, observed the object for 3-5 minutes, providing a detailed duration of the sighting.
The report mentions the observation of a big formation of 'flying saucers' above Hamilton Field, California, by multiple witnesses on 21st July, just a few days after Warren's sighting.
This was a Project Blue Book report, indicating an official investigation by the U.S. Air Force into UFO sightings.
sighted object: silent, bright, oblong or oval-shaped object
witnesses: Clayton Warren and multiple others on a subsequent date
